Player History
Drafted in 4th round, 58th overall pick, by Colorado in 2015...
Had first career hit (double) on 4/1/2015, off Dave Gurrola (STL)...
Hit first career homerun on 4/3/2015, off Barry Sechrist (STL)...
Injured on 4/10/2015 with a Torn Abdominal Muscle, out for 6 weeks...
Signed as a free agent by Houston on 2/12/2016 to a 5-year deal worth $14,800,000 per year...
Was selected to the 2016 Allstar game...
Injured on 8/24/2016 with a Strained Groin Muscle, out for one week...
Was selected to the 2017 Allstar game...
Won World Series with Houston in 2017...
Was selected to the 2018 Allstar game...
Won Player of the Week award on 9/4/2018, hitting .583 with 2 HR, 10 RBI...
Won World Series with Houston in 2018...
Injured on 6/18/2019 with a Pulled Anterior Cruciate Ligament, out for 3 weeks...
Drove in 6 runs against Brooklyn on 8/8/2019...
Traded from Houston to Cincinnati on 3/2/2020 (Going to CIN: RF Alonzo Alonso. Going to HOU: 3B Justin Tepper, CF Lawrence Sauter, P Ronald Diep, P Rueben Goodin)...
Was selected to the 2020 Allstar game...
Won Player of the Week award on 9/11/2020, hitting .450 with 4 HR, 10 RBI...
Sets a new season AL-Record for RBI with 128 on 9/17/2020...
Won Batter of the Month award on 10/1/2020, hitting .337 with 8 HR, 22 RBI...
Won World Series with Cincinnati in 2020...
Signed as a free agent by San Francisco on 2/5/2021 to a 4-year deal worth $20,000,000 per year...
Traded from San Francisco to Colorado on 2/1/2022 (Going to SF: P Jason Billie, P Cliff Jackson. Going to COL: P Alberto Rodriguez, LF Alonzo Alonso, P Edward Lawhon, P Christian McLin, 1B John
Miller)...
Won Player of the Week award on 4/24/2022, hitting .478 with 3 HR, 6 RBI...
Was claimed off waivers by Montreal on 8/15/2022.
Injured on 6/28/2023 with a Broken Finger, out for 5 weeks...
